member.name: T:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectoryObjectSecurity
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Provides the ability to control access to directory objects without direct manipulation of Access Control Lists (ACLs).

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectoryObjectSecurity.#ctor
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectoryObjectSecurity.#ctor(System.Security.AccessControl.CommonSecurityDescriptor)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified security descriptor.
member.param: The security descriptor to be associated with the new object.

member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified values.
member.returns: The object that this method creates.
member.param: The identity to which the access rule applies. It must be an object that can be cast as a .
The access mask of this rule. The access mask is a 32-bit collection of anonymous bits, the meaning of which is defined by the individual integrators.
true if this rule is inherited from a parent container.
Specifies the inheritance properties of the access rule.
Specifies whether inherited access rules are automatically propagated. The propagation flags are ignored if is set to .
Specifies the valid access control type.
The identity of the class of objects to which the new access rule applies.
The identity of the class of child objects which can inherit the new access rule.

member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Adds the specified access rule to the Discretionary Access Control List (DACL) associated with this object.
member.param: The access rule to add.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectoryObjectSecurity.AddAuditRule(System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAuditRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Adds the specified audit rule to the System Access Control List (SACL) associated with this object.
member.param: The audit rule to add.

member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified values.
member.returns: The object that this method creates.
member.param: The identity to which the audit rule applies. It must be an object that can be cast as a .
The access mask of this rule. The access mask is a 32-bit collection of anonymous bits, the meaning of which is defined by the individual integrators.
true if this rule is inherited from a parent container.
Specifies the inheritance properties of the audit rule.
Specifies whether inherited audit rules are automatically propagated. The propagation flags are ignored if is set to .
Specifies the conditions for which the rule is audited.
The identity of the class of objects to which the new audit rule applies.
The identity of the class of child objects which can inherit the new audit rule.

member.param: true to include access rules explicitly set for the object.

The security identifier for which to retrieve access rules. This must be an object that can be cast as a object.

member.returns: true if the DACL is successfully modified; otherwise, false.

The access rule to modify.
true if the DACL is successfully modified; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectoryObjectSecurity.RemoveAccessRule(System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAccessRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Removes access rules that contain the same security identifier and access mask as the specified access rule from the Discretionary Access Control List (DACL) associated with this object.
member.returns: true if the access rule was successfully removed; otherwise, false.
member.param: The access rule to remove.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectoryObjectSecurity.RemoveAccessRuleAll(System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAccessRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Removes all access rules that have the same security identifier as the specified access rule from the Discretionary Access Control List (DACL) associated with this object.
member.param: The access rule to remove.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectoryObjectSecurity.RemoveAccessRuleSpecific(System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAccessRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Removes all access rules that exactly match the specified access rule from the Discretionary Access Control List (DACL) associated with this object.
member.param: The access rule to remove.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectoryObjectSecurity.RemoveAuditRule(System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAuditRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Removes audit rules that contain the same security identifier and access mask as the specified audit rule from the System Access Control List (SACL) associated with this object.
member.returns: true if the audit rule was successfully removed; otherwise, false.
member.param: The audit rule to remove.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectoryObjectSecurity.RemoveAuditRuleAll(System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAuditRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Removes all audit rules that have the same security identifier as the specified audit rule from the System Access Control List (SACL) associated with this object.
member.param: The audit rule to remove.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectoryObjectSecurity.RemoveAuditRuleSpecific(System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAuditRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Removes all audit rules that exactly match the specified audit rule from the System Access Control List (SACL) associated with this object.
member.param: The audit rule to remove.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectoryObjectSecurity.ResetAccessRule(System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAccessRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Removes all access rules in the Discretionary Access Control List (DACL) associated with this object and then adds the specified access rule.
member.param: The access rule to reset.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectoryObjectSecurity.SetAccessRule(System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAccessRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Removes all access rules that contain the same security identifier and qualifier as the specified access rule in the Discretionary Access Control List (DACL) associated with this object and then adds the specified access rule.
member.param: The access rule to set.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.DirectoryObjectSecurity.SetAuditRule(System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectAuditRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Removes all audit rules that contain the same security identifier and qualifier as the specified audit rule in the System Access Control List (SACL) associated with this object and then adds the specified audit rule.
member.param: The audit rule to set.

member.name: T:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Defines the access rights to use when creating access and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.AppendData
member.summary: Specifies the right to append data to the end of a file.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.ChangePermissions
member.summary: Specifies the right to change the security and audit rules associated with a file or folder.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.CreateDirectories
member.summary: Specifies the right to create a folder.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.CreateFiles
member.summary: Specifies the right to create a file.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.Delete
member.summary: Specifies the right to delete a folder or file.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.DeleteSubdirectoriesAndFiles
member.summary: Specifies the right to delete a folder and any files contained within that folder.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.ExecuteFile
member.summary: Specifies the right to run an application file.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.FullControl
member.summary: Specifies the right to exert full control over a folder or file, and to modify access control and audit rules. This value represents the right to do anything with a file and is the combination of all rights in this enumeration.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.ListDirectory
member.summary: Specifies the right to read the contents of a directory.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.Modify
member.summary: Specifies the right to read, write, list folder contents, delete folders and files, and run application files. This right includes the right, the right, and the right.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.Read
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy folders or files as read-only. This right includes the right, right, right, and right.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.ReadAndExecute
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy folders or files as read-only, and to run application files. This right includes the right and the right.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.ReadAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy file system attributes from a folder or file. For example, this value specifies the right to view the file creation or modified date. This does not include the right to read data, extended file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.ReadData
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy a file or folder. This does not include the right to read file system attributes, extended file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.ReadExtendedAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy extended file system attributes from a folder or file. For example, this value specifies the right to view author and content information. This does not include the right to read data, file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.ReadPermissions
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy access and audit rules from a folder or file. This does not include the right to read data, file system attributes, and extended file system attributes.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.Synchronize
member.summary: Specifies whether the application can wait for a file handle to synchronize with the completion of an I/O operation.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.TakeOwnership
member.summary: Specifies the right to change the owner of a folder or file. Note that owners of a resource have full access to that resource.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.Traverse
member.summary: Specifies the right to list the contents of a folder and to run applications contained within that folder.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.Write
member.summary: Specifies the right to create folders and files, and to add or remove data from files. This right includes the right, right, right, and right.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.WriteAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and write file system attributes to a folder or file. This does not include the ability to write data, extended attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.WriteData
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and write to a file or folder. This does not include the right to open and write file system attributes, extended file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.name: F:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights.WriteExtendedAttributes
member.summary: Specifies the right to open and write extended file system attributes to a folder or file. This does not include the ability to write data, attributes, or access and audit rules.

member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Represents the access control and audit security for a file or directory.

true if the access rule is inherited; otherwise, false.

member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Gets the type that the class uses to represent audit rules.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemSecurity.RemoveAccessRule(System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Removes all matching allow or deny access control list (ACL) permissions from the current file or directory.
member.returns: true if the access rule was removed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemSecurity.RemoveAccessRuleAll(System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule)

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemSecurity.RemoveAccessRuleSpecific(System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Removes a single matching allow or deny access control list (ACL) permission from the current file or directory.
member.param: A object that specifies a user whose access control list (ACL) permissions should be removed from a file or directory.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemSecurity.RemoveAuditRule(System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAuditRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Removes all matching allow or deny audit rules from the current file or directory.
member.returns: true if the audit rule was removed; otherwise, false

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemSecurity.RemoveAuditRuleAll(System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAuditRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Removes all audit rules for the specified user from the current file or directory.
member.param: A object that specifies a user whose audit rules should be removed from a file or directory.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemSecurity.RemoveAuditRuleSpecific(System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAuditRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Removes a single matching allow or deny audit rule from the current file or directory.
member.param: A object that represents an audit rule to remove from a file or directory.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemSecurity.ResetAccessRule(System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Adds the specified access control list (ACL) permission to the current file or directory and removes all matching ACL permissions.
member.param: A object that represents an access control list (ACL) permission to add to a file or directory.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemSecurity.SetAccessRule(System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Sets the specified access control list (ACL) permission for the current file or directory.
member.param: A object that represents an access control list (ACL) permission to set for a file or directory.

member.name: M:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemSecurity.SetAuditRule(System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAuditRule)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Sets the specified audit rule for the current file or directory.
member.param: A object that represents an audit rule to set for a file or directory.
